sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action retrieves details of a candidate by ID.

Inputs:

  • Candidate ID - ID of the candidate for which candidate detail is to be retrieved.

Outputs:

  • Candidate Details - Candidate Details.
    • Candidate - Candidate personal details is retrieved.
      • First Name - First name of the candidate is retrieved.
      • Last Name - Last name of the candidate is retrieved .
      • Middle Name - Middle name of the candidate is retrieved .
      • Maiden Name - Maiden name of the candidate is retrieved.
      • Suffix - Suffix of the candidate is retrieved.
      • Salutation - Salutation of the candidate is retrieved.
      • Type - Type of candidate.
    • Email - Email of the candidate is retrieved.
    • Phones - Phone details of the candidate is retrieved.
      • Number - Specifies 10 digit phone number.
      • Extension - Specifies extension.
      • Country Code - Specifies country code.
      • Type - Specifies type of phone number, for e.g. primary or alternate.
    • Addresses - Address details of the candidate.
      • City - The city or area of the residence.
      • State - The state or region of the residence.
      • Country – The country of residence.
      • Street Address – The street address of the residence.
      • Zip Code – The zip or postal code of the address.
  • Status - Will be set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • Provided Candidate ID is invalid or not found.
  • Invalid username or password/token or the token has expired.
  • The user does not have sufficient permission to perform this action.

To use this action, the corresponding First Advantage connection and credential must be created and associated with the First Advantage Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
This action retrieves details of a candidate by ID.

Inputs:

  • Candidate ID - ID of the candidate for which candidate detail is to be retrieved.

Outputs:

  • Candidate Details - Candidate Details.
    • Candidate - Candidate personal details is retrieved.
      • First Name - First name of the candidate is retrieved.
      • Last Name - Last name of the candidate is retrieved .
      • Middle Name - Middle name of the candidate is retrieved .
      • Maiden Name - Maiden name of the candidate is retrieved.
      • Suffix - Suffix of the candidate is retrieved.
      • Salutation - Salutation of the candidate is retrieved.
      • Type - Type of candidate.
    • Email - Email of the candidate is retrieved.
    • Phones - Phone details of the candidate is retrieved.
      • Number - Specifies 10 digit phone number.
      • Extension - Specifies extension.
      • Country Code - Specifies country code.
      • Type - Specifies type of phone number, for e.g. primary or alternate.
    • Addresses - Address details of the candidate.
      • City - The city or area of the residence.
      • State - The state or region of the residence.
      • Country – The country of residence.
      • Street Address – The street address of the residence.
      • Zip Code – The zip or postal code of the address.
  • Status - Will be set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • Provided Candidate ID is invalid or not found.
  • Invalid username or password/token or the token has expired.
  • The user does not have sufficient permission to perform this action.

To use this action, the corresponding First Advantage connection and credential must be created and associated with the First Advantage Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
